member.name: T:VFU.Streaming.StreamCallbackTimeoutException
member.summary: Exception class for timeout handling of streaming callback methods. When a stream is running stopped stream is stopped the streaming can only completed successfully when the streaming callback is returned from the user code. To prevent the user for making dead locks the max. execution time for the streaming callback to finish when the stream was stopped a timeout can defined. When this timeout is exceeded the user callback is aborted using a to allow a finishing of the stream stopping method. If a StreamErrorCallback method was defined it is called with this exception as argument.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown when no a image data transfer is failed during streaming.

member.name: M:VFU.IVFUCam.AutoBrightnessControlSet(VFU.Target,VFU.Target)
member.summary: Sets current configuration of Automatic Brightness Control.
member.remarks:
= Hardware: Integration time is calculated on hardware and updated immediately.
= Software: With every image aquisition integration time is recalculated in API and set to camera.
= Hardware: Analog Gain is calculated on hardware and updated immediately.
= Software: Analog Gain is calculated on Software by every image aquisition.
Software automatic brightness control will update brightness only on every image aquisition. The time to reach the target brigthness depends on image aquisition rate.
If target hardware is selected brightness will be calculated and updated with every frame sensor outputs. (FreeRunning mode). The time to reach the target brigthness depends on the framerate of image sensor.
In a camera independent implementation the corresponding information method should be called, in order to check what are the supported configurations of the connected camera.
member.param: Target for automatic exposure control (AEC). Selectable targets are: Off, Software, Hardware.
Target for automatic gain control (AGC). Selectable targets are: Off, Software, Hardware.
member.exception: Thrown when method is not supported with given modes and . Call support information method for AutoBrightnessControlSet to check what modes are available to set.
Thrown when object is disposed.
Thrown if a internal exception has occurred.

member.name: M:VFU.IVFUCam.AsynchronousImageTransferSet(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Switch between synchronous and asynchronous image data transfers.
member.remarks:
The advantage of asynchronous image transfers is that you can receive images from multiple cameras at same time. The asynchronous mode is designed for use several USB host controllers on one pc with connecting one camera on every USB host controller:
Host Controller 1 <--> Cam1
Host Controller 2 <--> Cam2
Host Controller 3 <--> Cam3
Host Controller 4 <--> Cam4
Of course using asynchronous mode is possible to use with only one host controller, but is not recommended:
Host Controller 1 <--> Cam1, Cam2
Here it is important that asynchronous image transfers can overconsume USB bandwidth. This means if too many asynchronous transfers are started and running frames will drop.
It is important that image methods are not thread safe if asynchronous mode is enabled. It is only allowed to access with one Thread imageGet methods to one camera.
If synchronous image transfer (default) is activated, transfers from multiple cameras are queued and transfered one after the other.
Example 1: Two cameras are connected to one host controller. Image resolution is 320x240. Frame rate of one camera is 60 fps.
In synchronous image transfer mode only one camera is transferring at one time, frame rate of both cameras is 30 fps.
In asynchronous image transfer mode both cameras are transferring at same time, frame rate of both cameras is 60 fps. Transfers do not overconsume USB bandwidth.
Example 2: Two cameras are connected to one host controller. Image resolution is 3664x2764. Frame rate of one camera is 3,5 fps.
In synchronous image transfer mode only one camera is transferring at one time, frame rate of both cameras is 1,75 fps.
In asynchronous image transfer mode both cameras are transferring at same time, frame rate of both cameras is 0 fps. Transfers overconsume USB bandwidth, and frames are dropping.
Example 3: Two host controllers. Camera A is connected to host controller A. Camera B is connected to host controller B. Image resolution is 3664x2764. Frame rate of one camera is 3,5 fps.
In synchronous image transfer mode only one camera is transferring at one time, frame rate of both cameras is 1,75 fps.
In asynchronous image transfer mode both cameras are transferring at same time, frame rate of both cameras is 3,5 fps. Transfers do not overconsume USB bandwidth.
In a camera-hardware independent implementation the corresponding information method should be called, in order to ceck what are the supported configurations in combination with the connected camera.
member.param: If set to , then Asynchronous mode is used; otherwise, synchronous mode is used.
member.exception: Thrown when object is disposed.
Thrown if a internal exception has occurred.

member.summary: Get the device type of the operation device as enumeration .

member.name: P:VFU.OperationDeviceInfo.DeviceName
member.summary: Get the name of the operation device as string.

member.summary: Is set to true if the operation device was available for use in image processing operations.

member.name: P:VFU.OperationDeviceInfo.Performance
member.summary: Get the performance of the device in MHz.
member.remarks:
The ComputeUnits if devices as follows: nCores*clockPerCore
nCores is the number of computing cores of the device.
clockPerCore is the clock frequency of each core measured in MHz.

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_NumberOfKnees_Status
member.summary: Gives back if "one knee" or "two knees" is selected for High Dynamic Range Mode (HDR Mode).
member.returns: 0: two knees (Default). 1: one knee. -1: Read error.

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_KneeVoltages_RegValues_Set(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Set "Knee Voltages" for High Dynamic Range Mode (HDR Mode) in register values.
member.param: Knee Voltage in register value. Legal values: 0-31
member.returns: true: Knee Voltages successfully set. false: Failure while parametrize.

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_KneeVoltages_RegValues_Status
member.summary: Get status of "Knee Voltages" for High Dynamic Range mode (HDR) in register values.
member.returns:
legal values: 0-31
Value[0] = Voltage1 (default: 29)
Value[1] = Voltage2 (default: 24)
Value[2] = Voltage3 (default: 21)
Value[3] = Voltage4 (default: 4) short kneeVoltages[0] = -1: Read error.

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_KneeRatioTimes_Set(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Set "Knee Ratio Time" T2 and T3 for High Dynamic Range Mode (HDR Mode).
member.param: Knee Ratio Time value. Legal values: 0-15. kneeRatioTimes[0] = Knee Ratio T2 (default: 4). Value[1] = Knee Ratio T3 (default: 6)
member.returns: true: "Knee Ratio Time" T2 and T3 successfully set. false: Failure while parametrize.

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_KneeRatioTimes_Status
member.summary: Get "Knee Ratio Time" T2 and T3 for High Dynamic Range Mode (HDR Mode).
member.returns:
legal values: 0-15
Value[0] = Knee Ratio T2 (default: 4)
Value[1] = Knee Ratio T3 (default: 6)
short ratioTimes[0] = -1: Read error.

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_KneeTimes_RegValues_Set(System.Int16[])
member.summary: Set "Knee Times" for High Dynamic Range Mode (HDR Mode) in register values.

param.name: kneeTime
param.para: kneeTime[0] = knee time 1 (shutter width 1). Legal values: 1-480 (Default: 443).
kneeTime[1] = knee time 2 (shutter width 2). Legal values: 1-480 (Default: 473)

member.returns: true: "Knee Times" successfully set. false: Failure while parametrize.

remarks.para: If "Total Shutter Width time" is less "Shutter Width 1 time": "Shutter Width 1 time" = "Total Shutter Width time"
If "Total Shutter Width time" is less "Shutter Width 2 time": "Shutter Width 2 time" = "Total Shutter Width time"

member.name: M:VFU.V024.V024Cam.HDR_KneeTimes_RegValues_Status
member.summary: Get "Knee Times" for High Dynamic Range Mode (HDR Mode) in register values.
member.returns:
knee time 1 (shutter width 1) legal values: 1-480 (Default: 443)
knee time 2 (shutter width 2) legal values: 1-480 (Default: 473) short kneeTimes[0] = -1: Read error.

remarks.para: If "Total Shutter Width time" is less "Shutter Width 1 time": "Shutter Width 1 time" = "Total Shutter Width time"
If "Total Shutter Width time" is less "Shutter Width 2 time": "Shutter Width 2 time" = "Total Shutter Width time"
